body.p: Indian Hospital News Last week we had a number of patients come in from the Oneida country. Among them were Scharlene Smith, Betty Smith, Helen Hill, Iola Skenandore, and the Winnebagos who came in were Fred Sam, George Gi_en, Lena Blackcoon, and Jess Oâ€™Brien. Those who went home last week were, Jack Smith, Rinton Doxtator. Elizabeth Hammer and infant daughter Marjorie, Irvin Blackdeer, and Jacqueline King. A baby girl was born to Mr. and Mrs. Herman Browneagle of Mauston on March 10. They named her Deanna Lee. A baby girl was born to Mr. and Mrs. George Metozin of Kaukaune, on March 12. They named her Georgene Joyce. Since writing about the twins a couple of weeks ago, we have had numerous people inquire about them. Charlie Low Cloud is improving slowly. Frank Starr, a Chippewa Indian, hitch-hiked his way from Chicago up here to be examined and treated. He left today. News is scarce this week, it must be spring.
